sentences.en: I must disabuse you of your feelings of grandeur.
sentences.cn: 我必须去消除你的傲气.

sentences.en: I would like to disabuse your mind of the idea that your cousin has a feeling of hostility to you. On the contrary he spoke to me in the most friendly terms of you.
sentences.cn: 我想消除你以为你的堂兄对你有敌意的误会. 相反,他跟我说到你时,是以最友善的口吻说的.

sentences.en: If you think I'm going to lend you money, I must disabuse you of te wrong idea.
sentences.cn: 你若认为我会借钱给你, 我倒要劝你打消那念头.

sentences.en: In return , the man of practice offers pray , wish, enlighten and disabuse to the common people.
sentences.cn: 修行人则对俗家人施法 、 祝福 、 开导、解惑等等.

sentences.en: Let me disabuse of that foolish prejudices.
sentences.cn: 让我消除那个愚蠢的偏见.

sentences.en: Let me disabuse you of that foolish idea.
sentences.cn: 让我纠正你那种愚蠢的想法.

sentences.en: Let us disabuse ourselves of the idea that we are invincible.
sentences.cn: 让打消是战无不胜的错误念头.

sentences.en: Once we disabuse ourselves of the prejudice, we can cooperate with each other quite well.
sentences.cn: 一旦我们消除了这种偏见, 就能很好地合作.

sentences.en: Their view of country people was that they like to please strangers. I did not disabuse them of this notion.
sentences.cn: 他们认为乡下人爱讨好外地人。我没有纠正他们的这种想法。

words.tran_cn: 使省悟；解迷惑；释疑；矫正

trans.tran_cn: 解惑, 释疑, 使省悟
trans.tran_en: If you disabuse someone of something, you tell them or persuade them that what they believe is in fact untrue

trans.tran_cn: 去除…的错误想法，使醒悟
